page.title: 09UPPER ORCHARD
page.content: Mr.and Mrs. Hurley own a bed and breakfast guesthouse in Hoarwithy. About 100 people stay there in one year excluding Christmas. Apart from owning a guesthouse Mr.and Mrs. Hurley hold wine tasting weekends when people come and taste wines from all over the world.The wines are not blended wines. They are each made from one particular grape vine. The largest number of people that have stayed at Upper Orchard is 25 (including campers in the garden). Mrs. Hurley says that the most they can have staying in the house, including young children and babies, is 15. Mrs. Hurley likes walking and says that there are 14 footpaths in Hoarwithy. Some are obstructed by wire including Mrs. Hurley's favourite walk. The longest footpath starts in the village of Hoarwithy and goes to Harewood End.
